required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Nicotine Mini Lozenge in Relief of Provoked Acute Craving

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of the ability of a nicotine mini lozenge to provide early relief of craving for a cigarette in smokers

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Post-cue Baseline in Nicotine Craving Score at 5 Minutes
primary_outcome.description: Participants completed a nicotine craving assessment consisting of following five items: I have a desire for a cigarette right now, if it were possible I would smoke right now, All I want right now is a cigarette, I have an urge for a cigarette, I crave a cigarette right now. All participants indicated their craving intensity on a pre-drawn 100 mm scale ranging from 0 (disagree) to 100 (agree). At the end of the craving assessment period, mean VAS score was measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Post-cue Baseline in Nicotine Craving Score at 1 Minute
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post-cue baseline, 1 minute post treatment administration
secondary_outcome.description: Participants completed a nicotine craving assessment consisting of following five items: I have a desire for a cigarette right now, if it were possible I would smoke right now, All I want right now is a cigarette, I have an urge for a cigarette, I crave a cigarette right now. All participants indicated their craving intensity on a pre-drawn 100 mm scale ranging from 0 (disagree) to 100 (agree). At the end of the craving assessment period, mean VAS score was measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Post-cue Baseline in Nicotine Craving Score at 3 Minutes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post-cue Baseline, 3 minutes post treatment administration
secondary_outcome.description: Participants completed a nicotine craving assessment consisting of following five items: I have a desire for a cigarette right now, if it were possible I would smoke right now, All I want right now is a cigarette, I have an urge for a cigarette, I crave a cigarette right now. All participants indicated their craving intensity on a pre-drawn 100 mm scale ranging from 0 (disagree) to 100 (agree). At the end of the craving assessment period, mean VAS score was measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Post-cue Baseline in Nicotine Craving Score at 7 Minutes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post-Cue Baseline, 7 minutes post treatment administration
secondary_outcome.description: Participants completed a nicotine craving assessment consisting of following five items: I have a desire for a cigarette right now, if it were possible I would smoke right now, All I want right now is a cigarette, I have an urge for a cigarette, I crave a cigarette right now. All participants indicated their craving intensity on a pre-drawn 100 mm scale ranging from 0 (disagree) to 100 (agree). At the end of the craving assessment period, mean VAS score was measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Post-cue Baseline in Nicotine Craving Score at 10 Minutes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post-Cue Baseline, 10 minutes post treatment administration
secondary_outcome.description: Participants completed a nicotine craving assessment consisting of following five items: I have a desire for a cigarette right now, if it were possible I would smoke right now, All I want right now is a cigarette, I have an urge for a cigarette, I crave a cigarette right now. All participants indicated their craving intensity on a pre-drawn 100 mm scale ranging from 0 (disagree) to 100 (agree). At the end of the craving assessment period, mean VAS score was measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Treatment Related AEs, and Serious AEs (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Day 5 post treatment administration
secondary_outcome.description: AE was defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with study treatment/s. Treatment related AE was defined as any AE considered to be possibly, probably or highly probably related to study medication. SAE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death; is life threatening; requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization results in disability/ incapacity; is a congenital anomaly/ birth defect.

arm_group.description: mint mini lozenge with no active

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Current cigarette smokers who have smoked regularly, and smoke more than 20 cigarettes per day on a regular basis for at least a year;
- Good general health with (in the opinion of the investigator) no clinically significant and relevant abnormalities of medical history.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any disease that may interfere with the absorption, metabolism or excretion of the study product.
- A medical condition that might jeopardise the safety of the subject or the validity of the study results. For example, recent myocardial infarction or cerebrovascular incident (within 12 weeks of the screening visit), phenylketonuria, unstable or worsening angina pectoris, Prinzmetals angina or severe cardiac arrhythmia

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited at the clinical site.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of 423 screened participants, 323 were randomized while 94 did not meet the study criterion and remaining 6 discontinued due to other reasons. All randomized participants had a history of smoking more than 20 cigarettes per day.

group.title: Nicotine Lozenge 4 Milligrams (mg)
group.description: Participants received a single dose of 4 mg nicotine polacrilex mint lozenge, through oral route.

group.title: Matched Placebo
group.description: Participants received a single dose of matched placebo mint lozenge, through oral route.

group.title: Nicotine Lozenge 4 mg
group.description: Participants received a single dose of 4 mg nicotine polacrilex mint lozenge, through oral route.

group.title: Matched Placebo
group.description: Participants received a single dose of matched placebo mint lozenge, through oral route.

outcome.title: Change From Post-cue Baseline in Nicotine Craving Score at 5 Minutes
outcome.description: Participants completed a nicotine craving assessment consisting of following five items: I have a desire for a cigarette right now, if it were possible I would smoke right now, All I want right now is a cigarette, I have an urge for a cigarette, I crave a cigarette right now. All participants indicated their craving intensity on a pre-drawn 100 mm scale ranging from 0 (disagree) to 100 (agree). At the end of the craving assessment period, mean VAS score was measured.
outcome.population: Intention to Treat (ITT) population: All randomized participants who had at least one cravings assessment measurement post dose. The imputation of missing craving score was based on last observation carried forward (LOCF) technique.

group.title: Nicotine Lozenge 4 mg
group.description: Participants received a single dose of 4 mg nicotine polacrilex mint lozenge, through oral route.

group.title: Matched Placebo
group.description: Participants received a single dose of matched placebo mint lozenge, through oral route.

measure.title: Change From Post-cue Baseline in Nicotine Craving Score at 5 Minutes
measure.description: Participants completed a nicotine craving assessment consisting of following five items: I have a desire for a cigarette right now, if it were possible I would smoke right now, All I want right now is a cigarette, I have an urge for a cigarette, I crave a cigarette right now. All participants indicated their craving intensity on a pre-drawn 100 mm scale ranging from 0 (disagree) to 100 (agree). At the end of the craving assessment period, mean VAS score was measured.
measure.population: Intention to Treat (ITT) population: All randomized participants who had at least one cravings assessment measurement post dose. The imputation of missing craving score was based on last observation carried forward (LOCF) technique.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis considered the population’s change from post-cue baseline in craving score mean to be equal in both treatment groups at 5 minutes
analysis.estimate_desc: Treatment comparisons were made between 4 mg nicotine lozenge and placebo lozenge at 5% significance level.

All participants indicated their craving intensity on a pre-drawn 100 mm scale ranging from 0 (disagree) to 100 (agree). At the end of the craving assessment period, mean VAS score was measured.

outcome.population: ITT population: All randomized participants who had at least one cravings assessment measurement post dose. The imputation of missing craving score was based on LOCF technique.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Treatment Related AEs, and Serious AEs (SAEs)
outcome.description: AE was defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with study treatment/s. Treatment related AE was defined as any AE considered to be possibly, probably or highly probably related to study medication. SAE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death; is life threatening; requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization results in disability/ incapacity; is a congenital anomaly/ birth defect.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Day 5 post treatment administration
outcome.population: Safety population: All randomized participants who received the study treatments were considered evaluable for safety.

group.description: Participants received a single dose of matched placebo mint lozenge, through oral route.

reported_events.time_frame: All adverse events encountered or spontaneously reported following administration of any investigational product (including washout product), or for up to 5 days after the last administration of investigational product were recorded.

group.title: Nicotine Lozenge 4 mg
group.description: Participants received a single dose of 4 mg nicotine polacrilex mint lozenge, through oral route.

group.title: Placebo Lozenge
group.description: Participants received a single dose of matched placebo mint lozenge, through oral route.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
